node.title: 'Preparing for the worst': Indigenous communities at risk of chronic illness epidemic
node.alt: Nurse takes a woman's blood pressure
node.description: There are "serious concerns" for the many Aboriginal people living with chronic illnesses in regional NSW who did not keep up with their regular medical check-ups for fear of catching COVID-19.
node.content:
["Health groups have expressed fears the COVID-19 pandemic will move to an epidemic of chronic illness among the state's regional Indigenous population.\u00a0", "Regular GP appointments were down more than half in some communities during lockdown.", "Australian Bureau of Statistics data shows more than 12 per cent of people in NSW delayed seeing or did not see a doctor due to the virus and 7.6 per cent delayed or did not see a medical specialist.", "But the Rural and Remote Medical Services said 52 per cent of its 22,000 clients failed to see a GP from 2019-2020.", "It operates eight rural practices \u2014 almost a third of its patients are Indigenous.", "CEO Mark Burdack said Aboriginal people in smaller remote towns avoided travelling to larger towns because of the risk of infection.", "\"As a result, we project that a significantly larger percentage of Aboriginal people didn't maintain their chronic disease appointments which is a serious concern,\" Mr Burdack said.", "", "
Mr Burdack says it's a concern so many people with chronic conditions did not keep up their appointments.(Supplied)
", "Fifty-eight-year-old Wiradjuri woman Donna, from Orange in the state's central west, suffers from a variety of chronic illnesses including chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, or COPD, and diabetes.", "She put off her regular check-ups due to the risk of catching COVID. Now, she's relieved to be back in the doctor's chair after months of making do with telehealth.", "\"You can't really get help over the telephone, you just can't. It's not the same when you're not talking to them face to face,\" she said.", "She said not only did her diabetes and other physical ailments suffer during lockdown but her mental health too.", "\"I went into the doctors and I just broke down and cried the other week. I was like I don't want to live no more in this world \u2026 you get depressed,\" she said.", "\"I'm only six years off when my mum died and I want to live longer to watch my grandkids grow up.", "\"It makes you wonder if you don't get your health in check, you could go the same way.\"", "Donna is now back to her regular appointments at the Orange Aboriginal Medical Service where she also exercises twice a week.", "In 2018-2019, more than 51 per cent of Aboriginal people in the state had one or more chronic conditions that posed a significant health problem.", "", "
Donna was among a number of people who put off going to her regular check-ups due to COVID.(ABC News)
", "Orange Aboriginal Medical Service CEO Jamie Newman said the service was trying hard to get its patients back for regular appointments.", "He said while most patients responded well to telehealth, the service saw a decline in people presenting.", "\"The regularity has dropped,\" Mr Newman said.", "\"We won't know the real impact of COVID until about six months time [but] my biggest concern is that we probably will have people who are chronically ill, whether it's diabetes, or asthma, having a dual diagnosis of mental health.", "\"So we're preparing for the worst.\"", "The medical service provides GP, dental, mental health and a range of other services to about 3,500 Aboriginal people and the wider community.", "\"Every service is going to see an increase \u2026 so, the social, emotional wellbeing of our people, housing, employment, education, all those things will be exacerbated through this pandemic, we as a healthcare provider have to respond,\" he said.", "", "
Mr Newman says it will take about six months to see the real impact of COVID-19.\u00a0(ABC News Central West:\u00a0Arianna Levy)
", "
Low vaccination rates not helping
", "Mr Burdack said lower vaccination rates among the state's Indigenous population were not helping.", "Until November 16, 79 per cent of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in NSW had\u00a0been fully vaccinated, compared to 91 per cent of the general population.", "But things are more challenging in regional and remote areas.", "\"In towns where there are regular general practice services, and there's a strong and trusting therapeutic relationship between the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander patients and the doctor, we're finding that vaccination rates are extremely good,\" Mr Burdack said.", "\"But that's, of course not true for all towns, in rural and remote parts, some towns don't have a doctor.\"", "", "
Seventy-nine per cent of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are fully vaccinated in NSW.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "University of Newcastle professor and chair of RACGP Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health\u00a0Peter O'Mara said there is a particular group to target.", "\"We gotta get the younger ones on board with this \u2026 where the elders and the leadership in the community are in favour of it seems to flow through to the rest of the community,\" Mr O'Mara said.", "\"There's never been an easier way to save people's lives, just by putting a shot in someone's arm you save a life.\"", "", "
Vaccination rates are higher in regional towns that have a GP.(Supplied)
", "Mr Newman said primary health care in regional and remote areas had become more critical than ever, as health organisations faced\u00a0battles on multiple fronts.", "\"We can't lose sight of providing primary health care to our people, we can be participating in COVID, testings, vaccinations and boosters. But we're here to provide primary health care, we can't allow the pandemic to derail us,\" he said.", "\"If we're going to say that we're culturally responsive and safe, then we need to apply that \u2026 that's why we go above what any other health care provider will do.", "\"That's what separates us from any other health care provider \u2013 the definition of Aboriginal health should be applied to all people, not just Aboriginal people.\""]
